author: Dr Ben Miles
description:
The Australian net-casting spider Asianopis subrufa produces a unique core-sheath silk that combines elasticity and strength, allowing it to catch prey twice its size. This high resolution electron microscope image shows the nanoscale structures in detail, and could reveal how to engineer fibres with enhanced properties.

Source Article: https://www.newscientist.com/article/2506729-incredible-close-up-of-spider-silk-wins-science-photo-prize/
